website_summaries.verdict: This large wobble board can accommodate users of all heights and is built to last.
pros: Grippy surface keeps you in place
Suitable for indoor or outdoor use
cons: The bottom is slippery and shouldn't be used on wood, vinyl, or tile floors

customer_reviews.title: Customer service unresponsive
customer_reviews.text: It worked great but after a few months of use (I'm a 140 lb female and use this with a standing desk), the sandpaper surface wore out and it became slippery. Product has a 1-year warranty so I thought I'd contact customer service. No response after their website promised 48-hour turnaround on inquiries. Product is sturdy and works fine otherwise but maybe the seller should change it to a 3 month warranty if they're not going to honor their 1 year warranty. Update: Customer service never responded. I applied skateboard grip tape on it to replace the grippy surface. Works well with that intervention but otherwise don't count on it lasting more than a few months with daily use.
customer_reviews.author: BrooklynNY

customer_reviews.title: Great for Improving Balance!
customer_reviews.text: At a local health fair, I had my balance tested and rated about the same as the average 90 year old woman! That is 30 years older than I actually am, and I knew it was time to improve in that area. This is sturdy and challenging, and is an excellent addition to my daily exercise routine and I have found that it not only improves my balance, it also tones my core. So, for an inexpensive and effective anti-aging tool, I recommend a balance board, and this one is sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Linda HendrexTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: For Intermediate -> Advanced
customer_reviews.text: Good product, built well, but because the bottom is hard its a FAST balancing board and takes time to get used to. I'd say this is more for Intermediate -> Advanced balancing. Beginner balancing should use the flat blue mats, graduating to the half rubber ball, then this.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis BarringtonTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great, but grip falls off
customer_reviews.text: Love it, but the grip started wearing off in the first hour of using it. I use it at work at a standing desk. I would give a 5 Star if the grip didn’t wear off
customer_reviews.author: colton shields

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Love this ! , ! I orginally got this to help me with my balance. I'm 74 and had to spend time in bed because of an injury. I used this and noticed a differenc the first day. Dr. Has me taking it slow and easy but so glad I found this.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Dale Hall

customer_reviews.title: TOO SLIPPERY
customer_reviews.text: The hard plastic pivot on the bottom is TOO slippery for my use, both on carpet and hard floor. I need something that will not slide over the floor with pressure applied.
customer_reviews.author: Heronymous

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, I've found it a real aid to improving ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly, decently packaged. Very sturdy, I've found it a real aid to improving my balance. At 69, though I'm in great physical shape and work out diligently, I have been very annoyed by no longer having the ability to stand on one foot and maintain my balance. My core is strong, but something has been missing. After a couple weeks of short 5-10minutes of just trying to stay balanced, everything suddenly clicked yesterday, and I balanced for about 20 min. It is a sandpaper-like surface, and I never go barefoot, but it is not uncomfortable on my bare feet, I don't even feel the roughness. Excellent product at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: ddv

customer_reviews.title: Works Well, But Begins to Fall Apart After Repeat Use
customer_reviews.text: Grip tape starts wearing off within the first year, and the plywood is chipping apart. Not high quality if you intend to use it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wigdahl

customer_reviews.title: Great for core work while working from home
customer_reviews.text: I use a stand-up workstation at home and find myself shifting from foot to foot all day. I purchased this balance board to keep my core working while in countless video meetings and it is great. I didn't realize how poor my balance was until I started using the board. I stand on it barefoot and really feel muscles from my feet to abs firing to keep me from rocking. I used one of these years ago after I had an ankle rebuilt and should have remembered what a great tool it was to recover and build confidence back in my stability. Get one!
customer_reviews.author: Vandalay Industries

customer_reviews.title: Works for me, so far.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been able to stand on the balance board for more than 20 or 30 seconds without having to shift positions, but I will be able to do it soon. The board is solid and made to last. I was very impressed by how sturdy it is. So far it's worked exactly as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Deck

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected balance board
customer_reviews.text: My son and I are both using this board in the living room and kitchen and getting off the couch more, and that's always a good thing. We have ceramic tile floors, though, and the "ball" on the bottom of the board, for lack of a better term, is pretty hard, so it is slippery on the tile. I've put a piece of the stuff that you put under rugs to keep them from sliding around under the balance board to make it less dangerous on the tile. I would absolutely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Balance Board at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a lightning deal and was going to use as a second in my office, but this board is way better than my original at about half the price. I stand on this during long teleconferences to keep the blood flowing. It's a little too unstable for me to use while typing anything more than a few characters, but it is a great balance board. I can stand on it and read. For those wondering, this is a totally different animal than the Simply Fit board, the center is in a much smaller area and it's not really for twisting like that type of board. It is great for balance and squats.
customer_reviews.author: Katsolo

customer_reviews.title: Great for range-of-motion ankle exercises
customer_reviews.text: I broke my tibia and fibula seven months ago and had to have surgery which included 14 screws and two plates in the ankle area. I have struggled with range-of-motion since, and my limited physical therapy sessions had to stop because of the ‘rona. My PT recommended that I get this to continue exercises at home. It works well, and my husband also uses it sometimes for core exercises. It’s made of good quality materials and easily holds at least 220 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Rae Regenbogen

customer_reviews.title: Working out great!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is working out very well. I would recommend starting out very slow for very little time each attempt with something to hold on to right next to you. I have it next to my stationary bicycle and went falling over into the wall a few times. I am still working my way up, but its very rewarding gaining more and more balance and I can see the benefits in other physical activities. And the best part is its strengthening my feet and taking away weakness and pain I have been suffering from.
customer_reviews.author: ByronD

customer_reviews.title: great for indoors
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this and it arrived in a perfect time. currently we're in the middle of social distancing/shelter-in-place so this is keeping me entertained and off the couch. my 4 year old took over as soon as I opened it and he's been practicing his balance too. my dining table is at standing height so I would casually be drinking, eating, web browsing while balancing on the board. this is also great for older people too. I'm slowly getting my mom to try so she can exercise her leg strength since we're all stuck inside and weather outside is ugly. 10/10 would recommend!👌🏽
customer_reviews.author: Sheriane

customer_reviews.title: The blue sandpaper grip is pretty harsh (so yes
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for family PT. The blue sandpaper grip is pretty harsh (so yes, it does its job) to the point of needing shoes and socks on at all times with it. I'm worried the kids will drag it upside down and ruin our floors. Also, the bottom "ball" you balance on it super smooth, so the kids discovered you can pivot quickly on it without any friction. I would recommend adding some grip paper to the underside to avoid getting hurt.
customer_reviews.author: s.v.

customer_reviews.title: Great balance board
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. You can’t get any better for the price. I use it all the time and it’s great for improving your balance state of mind and overall health. The grip tape on it is great. It is a combination of clear and black grip tape. I would 100% recommend this it is so much fun to use. It’s not too tall so it’s not like you could get hurt on it while balancing. It’s just the right height so it’s challenging enough to balance being doable. Great product I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Michele April

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: I bought this balance board for my kids (aged 3 and 7) to work on their vestibular system. It's a perfect size for them and my 7 year old loves it. My 3 year old isn't there yet because she lacks balance of any kind, but she does like to use it when she can hold hands with someone else while she builds up her muscles. I wasn't planning on using it myself, but I can't help but do so--it takes up little floor space so it's out all the time, and the whole family (and guests!) makes good use of it. The purple "sandpaper" texture makes it great for both bare and socked feet. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthless Sprinkle

customer_reviews.title: Great for home
customer_reviews.text: I twisted my ankle and it was really bad, couldn't properly walk for about 9 months. I've been wearing a brace to do everything ever since. I started going to a chiropractor and he recommended this item for home use. In all honesty, I didn't think swiveling in circles was going to do anything for me, but I was wrong. After just a few weeks of using it every other day or so, I've noticed a huge difference. My ankle doesn't hurt as quickly or get tired anymore. I can bend it a lot more and it's definitely helped with my balance. I highly recommend this for at home therapy for anyone with ankle/knee/leg problems.
customer_reviews.author: Agnes Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and durable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a follow up to physical therapy. My hip started hurting about a year ago. I finally made it to the doctor where they recommended I go to physical therapy. One of the excersices they had me do invovled balancing on a balance board, along with other excersices using the balance board. Once I completed physical therapy (and feeling much better!!!) I wanted to keep up with all the stretches and excersices they showed me, so I purchased this balance board to allow me to do so. It has held up to its end of the bargain!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Nice Passive Exercise
customer_reviews.text: I've incorporated this into my day to day when I watch TV. It's nice to kill two birds and not feel like a total slob while I'm vegging out. Got this to help rehab what I believe to be a torn meniscus that's given me trouble for about 3 years... it's a subtle thing, but I believe it helps to work out muscle that don't get regularly taxed by a lot of standard exercise. I don't think you'll notice this thing working any miracles. But used consistently and incorporated with other PT it's going to help your stability issues in joints, core muscles, or posture.
customer_reviews.author: Sallyslim77

customer_reviews.title: Advanced balance board
customer_reviews.text: The 15-degree title angle is pretty advanced, but I was able to adjust in less than a day - using it in front of a standing desk. Note: the non-slip grip top is great, but there is NO padding whatsoever, so consider using with shoes. If they made a version with a soft "relief" padded top, it would be a perfect upgrade to a great product. This is also a great value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Toddo

customer_reviews.title: Love it,love the price and the size is good 17” would be GREAT!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Pain relief I thought was a dumb question it should’ve been COAR builder...so 5 stars YES!!! Love it, fun and easy to use!!! I think beginners need a chair to help balance or on carpet or foam yoga mat. Awesome price!!!! Holds more weight then I thought it would. Hubby and I have made a game of it, will buy a second one so I don’t have to share 😂🤣💖👏👏👏👏
customer_reviews.author: H. Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Helps with articulating your ankles while at work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a co-worker had one, and I was borrowing their balance board enough to warrant purchasing my own. The first one I got had the grip tape start wearing off on the first day I got it. See co-worker's balance board at top of picture and the one I received after 4 hours of usage. Had it replaced and the second is holding up much better. Do I notice anything materially different after purchasing this? No. I use it at my standing desk to provide my ankles with articulation above and beyond what office workers see on a normal basis. As a runner, I appreciate any non-standard movement to improve mobility. Would purchase again and recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: John Barbell

customer_reviews.title: BOTTOM IS FLAT, not at all challenging.
customer_reviews.text: This was not at all challenging. the bottom of the plastic is flat. It's Flat, which will make anyone think they are great at balancing. I'm 46, not athletic, recovering from ACL reconstruction and meniscus tear. THIS IS LOUSY.
customer_reviews.author: BOOHOOTIE

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: 1. Wish it was wider so my feet can be shoulder width apart when I squat on it. 2. Wish it was higher off the ground so the sides wouldn’t touch the ground so easily. I guess I haven’t learned my lesson- YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR 🙄
customer_reviews.author: Persianjerseyan

customer_reviews.title: I regret buying this because it's too popular in my house!
customer_reviews.text: Let's not get into how many times we've battled for the board. It's actually a lot of fun, and friends and I have had balance challenges, challenges to do push-ups with it, etc. My daughter is using it a lot to practice balance on one foot since she's a young ballet student. The only downside to this is that it will slip across hardwood floors. If you're balancing it it, it's fine, but for pushups, you risk it sliding. But that's not enough of an issue with the board itself to warrant deducting any stars. In fact, it keeps its five starts due to a friend now wanting to get this one. :)
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Get stable!
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted to add one to my gym equipment having used them at my Gym facility, but price was always an issue. This unit was a great price so hoping for a good product, I wasn't disappointed. I don't use the bands much, my wife does; I use my kettlebells, dumbbells, and tube resistance cords for warm-ups and it certainly helps your balance, I haveimpzoved on XC running courses so that is a plus. Recommend this, it is sturdy and does the job of units costing much more plus you get the bands.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce B.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, grippy surface, use on nonslip floor
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy and large enough for most people/feet to be effective for improving multidirectional stability. As others have noted, use this on nonslip flooring, such as cushioned carpeting. I also recommend using it while facing or beside a grab bar, heavy duty rail, ballet barre, or something similar you can use as a mount/balance/unmount assist or in case you start to lose balance or the unit slides. It’s nice that you can rock in multiple directions. It doesn’t take up much space when not in use and can tuck under furniture. The surface has a rough, grippy surface, perfect for use with trainers/tennis shoes. I would not use it barefoot, with sandals, or slip-on shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Tippy Claire

customer_reviews.title: Nice entry balance board
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was a good deal for the price. Board is thick and dome is securely attached. I wouldn't use on any hard surfaces though; the dome would most likely slip from the floor. Excersize tips are included and helpful. I don't have faith in the resistance bands though. I've used the medium band a few times and doubt its longevity. I'm pleased with what I got for what I paid.
customer_reviews.author: J. Laine

customer_reviews.title: Good test for me
customer_reviews.text: I'm doing PT and bought this as a backup for off days. The type of board they use is more flexible and I may track it down. This one make me work to do my two-minute drills. I think that is good. As i acclimate to this one, I believe it will be more of a challenge to balance, hence better for me in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: SpinDoctor

customer_reviews.title: Advanced balance board
customer_reviews.text: This is for people with very good balance already. I've been using balance boards when I go for physical therapy and have been doing very well in the PT's balance boards. This Yes4All board is a very different experience. I'm not able to get any sense of balance on it and therefore unable to use it. Sigh. For information, I'm a 69 year old woman in reasonably good condition.
customer_reviews.author: PegRose

customer_reviews.title: Good way to keep moving while at work
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I wanted something to use at the office for my stand up desk to keep me moving a bit. It took me no time to get acclimated to it (not so much my co-workers though! Lol). I can stand on it for hours and only stop when my feet get tired. I put it on top of my anti-fatigue mat so that it doesn't wear a hole in the carpet. I haven't had it but a week so I can't attest to how durable it will be yet however I'm very satisfied with the board, it makes me happy to use it!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara S.

customer_reviews.title: Crikey! This is hard! (In a good way...)
customer_reviews.text: Okay, this is probably really good for me because it's really hard to do. I recommend first using this item while standing in a doorway, so you can catch yourself as you inevitably fall over. It has taken me a while, but I can now balance pretty well on it for extended periods of time. My only gripe is that because of the texture on the portion where you stand, you cannot easily move your feet to redistribute your weight. I could see someone twisting their ankle or falling off of this item because of that feature. That's where I thank the doorway for saving me from a faceplant.
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Its okay but kind of boring
customer_reviews.text: I had fun with this for a few days, but I haven't found any real use for it, I am too wobbly on it to be able to use it while doing anything (such as computer or dishes). I did like that it feels very safe, plenty of grip so I don't worry about sliding off. Could have put my money to better use though.
customer_reviews.author: UpQuarkMom

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to work on your stability
customer_reviews.text: Bought it continue my PT exercises at home. The PT office had this stability board to do squats and this board was way cheaper than the ones similar to the PT office. It's a bit different as it is a circle but I've been able to work on my stability and do squats on it.
customer_reviews.author: HI Platypus

customer_reviews.title: Decent board but lack of motion is very limited
customer_reviews.text: I suffer from chronic vertigo at 49, brought on by God knows what a decade ago. My balance therapist suggested this board, albeit his is might higher in the office. This one is good, but not very high. I think it is almost TOO EASY in some regards, and if you "fall" you are only going about 2" off the floor. So, that said, great starter board, not that challenging, well made, and reliable. I am 200 lbs so I am sure you are skinnier than me. That's all.
customer_reviews.author: PAREVIEWER

customer_reviews.title: Slidey but solid
customer_reviews.text: Tends to slide on hard surfaces like wood or smooth tile. If you have any grippy shelf/drawer liner or maybe even a foam yoga mat, put that down first if your floor isn't carpeted or textured tile. Otherwise a great product! Sturdy construction.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: For advanced users! Very tilted. Traction and strong wood however.
customer_reviews.text: This board is for advanced users! The base is tall and you'll need to have good balance already. It does have top traction strips and a strong wide wooden top. I can't use this board as it's too advanced and will cause injury until I'm in better shape.
customer_reviews.author: pjo48

customer_reviews.title: Helps with balance
customer_reviews.text: I have had an injury to my inner ear and it has affected my balance. I started using this board and am slowly working up to being able to balance on one leg when standing on the ground. That had been almost impossible prior to using the balance board, but now is getting easier.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbie J McLaren

customer_reviews.title: Great for the office
customer_reviews.text: I use this at my stand up desk in my office. It's great to keep in motion throughout the day, but it can be a little distracting since it's fun to play around with. I find it's pretty easy to balance once you get a good foot position. Not very challenging, though, which is what I had wanted. It's a great size for me since I'm only 5'2", but I've let some others in the office play around on it who are taller and they said it wasn't a comfortable fit for them. So, if you're taller, this might not be for you. Overall, great product. Seems sturdy. I've had no issues using it on carpet.
customer_reviews.author: VM

customer_reviews.title: great board to use for improving balance and for post-surgery therapy
customer_reviews.text: great board for therapy after my knee surgery. I did too much in the beginning and my ankles were sore, so ease into balance work, particularly if it's post surrey
customer_reviews.author: KayW in MD

customer_reviews.title: Priced right!!!
customer_reviews.text: I own a very much more expensive product like this, need another because mine got acquisitioned by another member of my household. This one is a DEAL! Sure the edges could have had a little nicer finish, but for this price, this is an absolute winner!
customer_reviews.author: R^2

customer_reviews.title: Great for Range of Motion
customer_reviews.text: They had one of these where I did my PT after breaking my ankle, and it was part of the regimen they had me do every time... 30 rotations to the right, 30 rotations to the left. The purpose was to loosen up the tight muscles in my ankle. It was the very best part of PT. I knew it... and decided that was one piece of equipment to invest in. This one is perfect. It is solid, just the right size, and it will probably be around a hundred years from now. Nothing to break on it, and it works fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Amy K

customer_reviews.title: Everybody wants a turn!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my dad for Christmas. (He's a 75-year-old physician who knows the importance of maintaining balance.) I didn't expect it to be the most popular toy of the evening, but it was. For young and old alike. More than that, though, my dad is texting me updates on his progress - how long he's able to keep the edges from touching the ground, how long he's able when he closes his eyes (which makes it exceedingly more difficult). Great product, super sturdy, and fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny P.

customer_reviews.title: It's easier than it looks.
customer_reviews.text: This balance board is very well made. It is easier to balance than I expected. In my physical therapy, they had a balance board that only rocked one direction and it was harder to balance on than this. I think that's because the curve radius on the bottom is pretty big. (It also has a very small flat spot in the center.) But I use this for my continuing home therapy and it seems to give me a similar result.
customer_reviews.author: Good Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good board, faulty grip tape, still worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The board feels sturdy, it’s a little small for me at 6’2” size 10 shoe, but it’s manageable and should strengthen the ankles as intended. There appears to be an issue with the grip tape. I got this board today and have spent one hour on it and a good chunk of the grip came off already.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this board as part of my ongoing PT for chronic health issues. My physical therapist was impressed with the high quality of this product. We now have it incorporated into my daily routine and it is easy to use. The wood is thick and the half ball which it balances on is of a high quality. There is a textured surface on top which I personally appreciate as a safety aid. I would definitely purchase again. I am glad I did my research and appreciate all the reviews. This helped me make my decision.
customer_reviews.author: Loon lover

customer_reviews.title: jerky motion rather than wobble
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item as recommended by my physical therapist to continue my therapy for a broken leg. The one at the therapist clinic moved smoothly and would hold steady once you balanced your weight. This one is almost impossible to use without falling off.
customer_reviews.author: Clara

customer_reviews.title: Nicely made
customer_reviews.text: Quality feels good for the price. It's pretty easy to balance on, so if you prefer that this might be the balance board for you. If you want more of a challenge, I'd recommend something else though.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Georgian

customer_reviews.title: Slips on carpet and hardwood and tile; fix with non skid mat
customer_reviews.text: It arrived in an opened box but all was ok. I used it twice today for the first time, about 5 minutes each time. My upper legs are feeling the muscles tonight. I hope it will help my balance over time. It is quite slippery, however, so I put it on a non- slip mat.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma R.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sturdy and fun! Good amount of room to stand on and has sandpaper like traction to prevent you from sliding. Just don’t do this on hard wood or tile , just on a safe surface like carpet, etc! It’s actually not difficult for me to balance on it and I think it’s helping me strengthen my ankles which have taken a hard beating over the years. I’ve tried the famous plastic balance board on the past and I thought I was going to snap it in half ! So this is a fantastic (and cheaper) alternative !
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and value. The reviews were good but I was still impressed with the item received !!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and value. The reviews were good but I was still impressed with the item received !! This is a robustly designed and manufactured product meeting all the representations in the product narrative. I wish I had found the wobble board earlier and this one was solid and durable. A more costly product will not deliver more benefit in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Parnell

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality wood and base is attached quite securely. Great value! My only complaint is that it slides across our hardwood floors pretty easily, unlike the wobble boards with the rubber ball in the center, but I guess that just adds another element of difficulty. For now, I use it on our shorter-pile carpets and it’s great! You can even twist back and forth on it like those corny “as seen on tv” curved boards. I got it because my physical therapist recommended it, and it really has helped my balance already.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie S.

customer_reviews.title: Helps a lot with tendinitis
customer_reviews.text: My PT had a wobble board that I was using for visits. Between this and my night split it really helped to move my recovery along. It is well made and stable for the price and is easily tucked away and pulled out. It it good also for any stability issues or for yoga. Considering buying one for my Mom to address some of her balance and stability issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Standing desk plus plus!
customer_reviews.text: I use this everyday at work with my standing desk that I built out of Ikea parts since I purchased this in December. Its well worth the small investment. I've noticed that my posture has improved along with core strength, plus it makes standing a bit more interesting!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Pen Regular

customer_reviews.title: The blue one was perfect - the top was well glued down and smooth
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two. The blue one was perfect - the top was well glued down and smooth. - On the black one, the top surface was puckered and uneven. Looked like it was coming unglued.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy S.

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was slightly larger
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a good wobble board for the price. Well made and easy to use, love the sandpaper grit layer on top. Good construction of solid wood. Only thing is I wish it was about 2-3" wider. I have size 12 mens feet and it just feels like i'm barely able to get my feet on. So, be advised, its a very good board but a bit on the small side.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E.

customer_reviews.title: Child sized
customer_reviews.text: Read the size info! This is so small. It’s a board for a teenager not a grown man or woman. The non under the platform is plastic so if you don’t use it on a rubber mat you will slip and get hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Russell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Wobble Board that I'm using for rehabilitation
customer_reviews.text: I have been tasked with building the muscles in my ankles lower leg and feet. This wobble board is a very sturdy product made from wood and durable materials. I have enjoyed the challenge of learning to balance on it and would recommend looking up some brief workouts on Youtube after it arrives. Well built solid product. Up to the user to put the time in after it arrives.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: All I can say about this product is if you can steady yourself for more than 15 seconds then you probably don't need it. It is very unstable - not in the sense that the board might break (because it is very solid) but in the sense that it is a HUGE struggle just to not fall off. Couldn't steady myself for more than 5 seconds
customer_reviews.author: Cgm

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy, great price, good angles for beginner balance training. Do squats, push ups etc. I'm 6'1 185lbs. I've jumped on this thing like a kid. It's stands up to it all. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tony J

customer_reviews.title: Great for calf Physical Therapy
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this about two weeks ago. Had back surgery and then my calf stopped working right after. My physical therapists had a version of this so I thought I would give it a try, honestly anything to help my calf get working again. I have been using it every day at work ( I have a standup desk) I use it to focus on the one leg. Been helping me build up strength. It has a sand paper like grip to it, very grippy, and lets me work the calf and foot. Works great for me and arrived quick.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: A perfect toy for my 10 year old that encourages health
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 10 year old for his birthday. He's a busy boy and I like that it is something that doesn't take up a lot of room, but still encourages him to be active. He loves it and it is a hot commodity between he and his older brother to exert energy on! Great price, and I'd even consider it as a gift when his friends have birthdays!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Was sent a used product.
customer_reviews.text: Somewhat disappointment. The top looks brand new... seems sturdy. However the bottom was pretty scratched up. I didn't purchase a used board, but this seems to be what I was sent. I'm hoping the last person didn't return it because of product issues and it will work the way it's supposed to. I'm giving it 4 stars newscaster overall the product seems to be good. Just disappointed in customer service.
customer_reviews.author: LizW

customer_reviews.title: Kids find it fun, too!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my 11 year old son, who always likes to be moving. We keep this out in the living room and even as I was just writing this, he stepped on for a little wiggle before moving on. Everyone in the family has used it; as we are watching a show or just standing around having a conversation. Our balance has improved and we just find it enjoyable!
customer_reviews.author: Alea Laughery

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! I have a knee injury which prevents me from doing squats or much lower body, but standing on this, while watching TV, really works the fine muscles in just about every part of my body, no pain to my knee, etc. My grandson loves it too, he's 2. LOL This also holds my 280#, 6'6 husband, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Karo56

customer_reviews.title: Super fun, sturdy as hell, I use it way more than I thought I would
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS THING! I didn't realize how much I would love it before purchasing it, but it's so fun and easy to do... I leave it in the middle of my living room floor and my husband and I stand on it whenever we walk past. It's made a noticeable improvement in my balance. Some reviews said it's not good for hardwood, so I had it on a towel for a while. Husband didn't know and put it on floor, but it's not caused any markings. Hopefully it won't.
customer_reviews.author: Aliya

customer_reviews.title: It's fantastic! There seemed to be many different companies with ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my standing desk at work. It's fantastic! There seemed to be many different companies with the same item, and Yes4All looked good as they have a lot of other products. I'm glad I went with theirs, as it was cheaper than a lot of others, and seems entirely identical. I'm 6'0 and 220 lbs and I'm pretty fit. It's challenging enough to give me something to work with, but it's also stable enough (with practice) to reliably work while standing on. I've only used it for a day but I'm looking forward to the improvements it will add to my daily life, and to help my ankles!
customer_reviews.author: Zekers

customer_reviews.title: Slides easily
customer_reviews.text: Needs a grippier surface, slides when try to use with a patient one footed. Not safe on tile. Otherwise well built.
customer_reviews.author: P. Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for Work!
customer_reviews.text: Love this balance board! I wanted a low-cost balance board option for work because I tend to sink into one hip or the other at my standing desk. Generally, I'd say I have good balance, and this is super easy to balance on while working! (Doing emails, knocking out tasks, etc.) Great value. Also, I used this on carpet, probably wouldn't recommend for hardwoods.
customer_reviews.author: Flowyandfun

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and effective
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to my strengthening and balance improvement regimen. Price was good, and it really helps. I noticed an improvement in less than a week, and I expect continued improvement and core strengthening support as I continue to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Love Kaua`i

customer_reviews.title: Works well with standing desks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for use with a standing desk at work. I was worried that the platform would not be large enough, but after using it for a couple weeks it works just fine. I like that it is a full 360 degree balancing instead of just front to back or side to side. For the price, you can't beat it. I would recommend this to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: good for practicing balance.
customer_reviews.text: its good. I bought it to help with balance after medical issue. I stand on it while working at my stand-up desk. It is helping me get my balance back.
customer_reviews.author: Gina W.

customer_reviews.title: A Center Piece!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this piece of equipment. Who knew something so simple could make you feel this amazing! I feel that standing on this while using my stand up desk allows my feet, legs, knees, and back to feel at ease. I am now standing up about 45mins more than I normally would. Did you know balancing on this board alone is still considered exercise, I'm sure you wont lose a hundred pounds in a month but it does shed a few calories.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Vance

customer_reviews.title: A Balanced review...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this silly thing. She is always practicing her dancing on this. It's very sturdy. There is no slippage on the top. The bottom though is a different story. This item is NOT to be used on a wood floor or tile because the bottom is a hard plastic that slips VERY easily. It should only be used on a carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Blowzo

customer_reviews.title: Office Ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: This may have been the best decision I have made for my office. I have a sit stand desk, and decided on a whim to try this. I just wanted to stay a little more active while at my 8 hour job, and this definitely fits the bill. It is definitely a work out and I was sore the first couple days but I can already see huge improvements in my leg muscle and balance, and definitely notice an improvement in posture, and when I don't use it, I feel stiff and achy at the end of the day.. I would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Stability and no knee pain
customer_reviews.text: The reason I bought this balance board was to strengthen my core and my knees. I use it in between tv commercial breaks on a daily basis. The first time I stood on the board ..yes I was wobbly but every time I used it My balance got better and better... now I’m so used to it it’s like riding a bike and not falling off. By the way I had to buy a long mat for safety for the floor since I don’t have carpet throughout the house...
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: Actually a fun addition to the home gym
customer_reviews.text: I just received this and tried it out. I was surprised how difficult it was, and I look forward to working on my balance using this product. Overall, I'm impressed with how solid it is. I can already tell it will be a useful and fun addition to the home gym (my spouse and I got some good chuckles out of trying it for the first time).
customer_reviews.author: B.A.2010

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, good for workouts
customer_reviews.text: Easy for beginners to use (my 9 year old son loves it), and excellent for improving balance/posture. Workouts with this add a whole new challenge! The board is wide enough that you can get a good stance on it, and the textured top helps your feet grip and stay in place. A bit easier to use on a rug as opposed to hard wood floor.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool. I sometimes put it under my feet when I am sitting and move around to wake up my ankles. I sometimes put it on the seat of the chair and sit on it to wiggle around and wake up my spine. And I sometimes put it on the floor in front of my standing desk and wake up my whole balance system while I read and type. It is sturdy and really helpful to bring in movement while I would otherwise be sitting or standing still.
customer_reviews.author: Kimet

customer_reviews.title: It ain't as easy as it looks.
customer_reviews.text: I STILL have to hold on to furniture, I slipped on it once (never knew the ground would come up that fast), but it IS building my flexibility and balance, just not as quickly as I thought. I wouldn't take it outside yet, pride is hrder to replace than balance. But if nothing else, I can see just how much I need to do.
customer_reviews.author: 2004done

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Rehabilitation
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, as recommended by my PT, to recover from my sprained ankle injury (grade 3). It's helped a ton, and the quality is actually really good, much better than what I was expecting for such a reasonable price. If you're in the market for a wobble board and possibly some elastic bands then you've found the right product.
customer_reviews.author: SlickRick

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really fidgety when I have to sit for long periods of time. Fidgeting is reduced if I cross my legs...but I don't find that a fabulous position for my knees when done for several hours in a row. So I bought this balance board to stick under my desk as a footrest and target for my fidgeting at work. It's been a nice outlet and has helped discourage me from unhealthy knee positions.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use like a BAPS board for my home health patient that had ankle surgery. The home health company that I work for would not purchase a BAPS board due to the high cost. I purchased this instead and it worked well for my patient. He was able to regain ankle range of motion.
customer_reviews.author: vieve6

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and useful
customer_reviews.text: Bought to keep me occupied while at my standing desk as I tend to lean and fidget a lot. It adds a significant couple of inches to your height and the range of motion may be a bit much for someone on wood or tile floors, but it works great with my standing desk mat. I didn't buy it for any pains and it wasn't a recommendation from a physical therapist or anything. Much cheaper than a lot of other balancing board options and the resistance loop bands that came with it seem to be strong and worthwhile.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Favorite part of PT
customer_reviews.text: I am using this as part of physical therapy after breaking my ankle. I really like it and can see lots of good uses for it once my ankle is strengthened. Just the balancing is good for your core muscles!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Happy Dancer
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my tiny dancer and she loves it. Not just for working on her balance but to do planks on as well. She gets so excited at every second she can balance longer in coupé
customer_reviews.author: LJB

customer_reviews.title: It does help stretch my ankles. But it's very ...
customer_reviews.text: It does help stretch my ankles. But it's very bumpy when trying to use it. Harder to balance on than ones with the rounded supports on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Lane

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed
customer_reviews.text: I have back issues and used a similar device during my physical therapy. So I ordered a balance board. It's hard at first but once you get used to it it becomes easier. The board helped with my groin and thy muscles as well as core. I make a game of it trying to stay on it for 10 minuets
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful.
customer_reviews.text: Very unstable and can push out from under you if you are not careful. My husband put 'rockers' on it at the suggestion of my physical therapist. Now it works well and still does the job of helping to better my balance.
customer_reviews.author: Jo-Ann Wright

customer_reviews.title: Bottom is very slippery.
customer_reviews.text: the bottom of the board is slippery. definitely cant use in on wood, vinyl or tile floor. Carpet is suspect as well. Do I have to scratch up the bottom like a pair of new shoes? Or maybe a piece (sleeve) to insert it into to make it stable and still rotate. Not sure if I will keep it or not.
customer_reviews.author: kz67d8

customer_reviews.title: Every kid/person should have this
customer_reviews.text: Every kid/person should have this. Got it for my daughter who liked to stand on a ball while watching TV, but that was unsafe. She was skeptical at first, but now carries it everywhere! I tried it out and I could feel all my abdominal muscles gently working under my layers of fat. Great concept, excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My son's use this all the time. Has really helped with stability and core strength. Great product for the cost!
customer_reviews.author: okc

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, major boost to working at a standing desk
customer_reviews.text: This thing is well made. Only downside is that the grip is basically sandpaper - so bid your socks and those soft slippers goodbye. That said, I'm not sure what would work better. What really sold me, though, is that when using this at my standing desk, I feel no back pain and appreciate the opportunity to stretch my hamstrings and exercise my calves. It's a little wobbly so be sure of your balance.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Price and quality is great!
customer_reviews.text: I'll be using this to stand up at my desk while I work on the computer. It will help keep my body in movement since standing statically is just as bad as sitting. The construction is sturdy and it's big & small enough to allow you to widen your stance or narrow your stance based on how much you want to train for balance. I'm happy with the purchase because the price was right too! The whole family can use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect balance device.
customer_reviews.text: Of course, this product is not stable at all! It is extremely well balanced, very sturdy, can handle higher weight limits, and is an incredible balance device. It takes a few days to get used to it, but then the body acclimates to having a different center to balance on. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: dealhunter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 6 year old who is learning to ice skate and play hockey. Its awesome! Perfect for beginners. Wide range of motion but not too advanced. The wood is thick and sturdy and I love the color option!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Decker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent physict therapy and stand up desk tool!
customer_reviews.text: Im 25 and have a bad knee and have been recovering from surgery. I've used this for physical therapy and it's funny bc my bad knee is better at balancing than the other one now! I now use this at work at my standing desk too. It's a good tool for PT and keeping you from sitting at your desk all day.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I got the board to help rehabilitate my sprained ankle and it’s been wonderful. The bands where an extra bonus and I use those to work out. They came quickly and on time, and the item was as pictured.
customer_reviews.author: Kattiebugg

product_meta.title: Yes4All Wooden Wobble Balance Board - Round Balance Board/ Stability Board for Physical Therapy, Home Gyms
feature_bullets: GREAT FOR BALANCE TRAINING: Improves core strength, posture, enhances coordination, sense of balance and visual sense. Great to strengthen the targeted muscles, ligaments, tendons and joints

DURABLE, NON SLIP SURFACE: Premium Wooden Balance Board with anti-skid pad on the surface provides a secure grip for absolute safety. 15.75 inch diameter large enough for both feet. Support up to 300 lbs
360 DEGREE ROTATION and 15 DEGREE TILTING ANGLE: 360 degrees rotation and up to 15 tilting degree, great to perform side to side, front to back, stretch and circular drills

VERSATILE, COMPACT BALANCE BOARD: With the lightweight, portable design, this balance board is great for Balance Exercises, Home Gyms, Gyms, Sport Performance Enhancement, Rehabilitation, Strength and Balance Workouts
COMPACT SIZE – USE ANYWHERE: Designed with a portable size so that you can carry it anywhere for quick workouts at home, gym or you can take it to the office and use it under your standing desk

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
